results.title: Preconception Antidiabetic Drugs in Men and Birth Defects in Offspring : A Nationwide Cohort Study.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@-exposed offspring (n = 1451) had an elevated @<m>DISEASE_Abnormalities_Drug_Induced</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000014 @@@birth defect@@@ frequency (aOR, 1.40 [CI, 1.08 to 1.82]).

citations.NLM: Wensink MJ, Lu Y, Tian L, Shaw GM, Rizzi S, Jensen TK, Mathiesen ER, Skakkebæk NE, Lindahl-Jacobsen R, Eisenberg ML. Preconception Antidiabetic Drugs in Men and Birth Defects in Offspring : A Nationwide Cohort Study. Ann Intern Med. 2022 May;175(5):665-673. PMID: 35344380
citations.BibTeX: @article{35344380, title={Preconception Antidiabetic Drugs in Men and Birth Defects in Offspring : A Nationwide Cohort Study.}, author={Wensink MJ and Lu Y and Tian L and Shaw GM and Rizzi S and Jensen TK and Mathiesen ER and Skakkebæk NE and Lindahl-Jacobsen R and Eisenberg ML}, journal={Ann Intern Med}, volume={175}, number={5}, pages={665-673}}

results.title: Hypothesis: Metformin is a potential reproductive toxicant
results.text_hl: Our recent nationwide study by Wensink and colleagues showed an association between preconception paternal @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment and genital @<m>DISEASE_Abnormalities_Drug_Induced</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000014 @@@birth defects@@@ in boys in Denmark.

citations.NLM: Tavlo M, Skakkebæk NE, Mathiesen ER, Kristensen DM, Kjær KH, Andersson AM, Lindahl-Jacobsen R. Hypothesis: Metformin is a potential reproductive toxicant Front Endocrinol (Lausanne). 2022;13():1000872. PMID: 36339411
citations.BibTeX: @article{36339411, title={Hypothesis: Metformin is a potential reproductive toxicant}, author={Tavlo M and Skakkebæk NE and Mathiesen ER and Kristensen DM and Kjær KH and Andersson AM and Lindahl-Jacobsen R}, journal={Front Endocrinol (Lausanne)}, volume={13}, pages={1000872}}

results.title: Genital defects seen in sons of men taking major diabetes drug.
results.text_hl: Large study hints that taking @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ before conception could raise risk of @<m>DISEASE_Abnormalities_Drug_Induced</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000014 @@@birth defects@@@ by affecting sperm.

citations.NLM: Wadman M. Genital defects seen in sons of men taking major diabetes drug. Science. 2022 Apr;376(6588):16-17. PMID: 35357930
citations.BibTeX: @article{35357930, title={Genital defects seen in sons of men taking major diabetes drug.}, author={Wadman M}, journal={Science}, volume={376}, number={6588}, pages={16-17}}

results.title: A meta-analysis of metformin and insulin on maternal outcome and neonatal outcome in patients with gestational diabetes mellitus.
results.text_hl: A meta-analysis of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ on maternal outcome and neonatal outcome in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Gestational @DISEASE_MESH:D016640 @@@gestational diabetes mellitus@@@.

results.title: [Cross-Sectional Study on Adverse Effects of Metformin Hydrochloride on 130 Patients Type 2 Diabetic Admitted to Medical Center and Diabetes Home of Sidi Bel-Abbes].
results.text_hl: Five (3.85%) @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ had a total and lasting intolerance to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MetforminHydrochloride@@@ leading to its discontinuation following persistent @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@.

results.title: Interventions for preventing the progression of autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease.
results.text_hl: Somatostatin analogues probably increase @DISEASE_Alopecia @DISEASE_MESH:D000505 @@@alopecia@@@, @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@ or @<m>DISEASE_Abnormalities_Drug_Induced</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000014 @@@abnormal faeces@@@, @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@ and @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ but may have little or no effect on @DISEASE_Anemia_Hemolytic @DISEASE_MESH:D000743 @@@anaemia@@@ or @DISEASE_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D007239 @@@infection@@@.

citations.NLM: St Pierre K, Cashmore BA, Bolignano D, Zoccali C, Ruospo M, Craig JC, Strippoli GF, Mallett AJ, Green SC, Tunnicliffe DJ. Interventions for preventing the progression of autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease. Cochrane Database Syst Rev. 2024 Oct 2;10(10):CD010294. PMID: 39356039

results.title: Antiproliferative effect of metformin on the endometrium--a clinical trial.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: We conclude that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ could be used as an effective antiestrogenic agent in control of @<m>DISEASE_Abnormalities_Drug_Induced</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000014 @@@abnormal@@@ @DISEASE_Uterine_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D014591 @@@endometrial proliferative disorders@@@.
